sentences.sContent: Delay always breeds danger; and to protract a great design is often to ruin it.
sentences.sContent_eng: Delay always breeds danger; and to protract a great design is often to ruin it.
sentences.sCn: 推迟经常孕育危险；拖延一个伟大的工程常常意味着毁灭它。

sentences.sContent: To protract the suspense, he paused for a considerable period of time before telling us the result of the experiment.
sentences.sContent_eng: To protract the suspense, he paused for a considerable period of time before telling us the result of the experiment.
sentences.sCn: 为了延长悬念，他在告诉我们实验结果之前停顿了相当一段时间。

remMethod.val: pro(向前) ＋ tract(拉) → 向前拉 → 延长， 拖长

words.tran: 伸肌；分度器；伤处异物摘出器
拖延；绘制；伸展（protract的过去分词）

trans.tranOther: to lengthen or extend (a speech, etc); prolong in time
